Table 4. Varying the IoU threshold for positive proposals 
when training S-RCNN. 
threshold

applying masks on original image or feature maps does not 
make much difference. But considering time efficiency, di-
rectly applying masks on feature maps is preferred in real ap-
plications. The second is which IoU threshold should we use 
to define positive proposals for S-RCNN? S-Objects are usu-
ally heavily occluded. Estimating the BBoxes for them are 
tougher than P-Objects, thus better proposals may help. We 
try 0.5, 0.6 and 0.7 as the IoU thresholds of positive propos-
als for S-RCNN. Results in
columns: Estimating the BBoxes for them are
tougher than P - Objects , thus better proposals may help .
